Description of incident: Altrec discovered a potential information security incident involving the American Express credit cards of people who used the site. Customer information may have been compromised between June 2010 and March 2012.  The potential breach was discovered on May 7, but a detailed forensic investigation did not uncover any evidence of a security breach.  Customer names, addresses, American Express card account numbers, expiration dates, and four digit security codes were stored in Altrec's database and could have been exposed if anyone had accessed it.
